body.p: An understanding of GNU autotools (automake, autoconf etc.) can be useful when working with ebuilds:

ul.li: Finding and correcting build issues is often easier if the build system is not seen simply as a scary black box.
The autotools input files can help when determining a package's build-time dependencies.
The risk of accidentally breaking something by patching the wrong file at the wrong time is greatly reduced if the relationship between the build system files is understood.

body.p: Autotools is a collection of related packages which, when used together, remove much of the difficulty involved in creating portable software. These tools, together with a few relatively simple upstream-supplied input files, are used to create the build system for a package.
